body.p:
To His Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of the Commonwealth of
Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Oldham County would respectfully represent to your Excellency that at a Justices Court for said County held on the 22th day of April. 1862 Amandy and Ellen free girls of Color were each fined in the sum of Fifteen dollars, upon a warrant Chargeing that they were present at an unlawful assemblage of slaves in the neighborhood of their residence We are satisfiied that they were ignorant of the wrong they were committing, and that they were prevailed on by others to accompany them to the meeting, The girls most of us have known from there infancy they are moral, Civil, and industrious and no charge of any misdemeanor has ever before been made against either of them, They reside with their Father who is a free man, and who is also known as an industrious, moral man, he was raised in our neighbohood, and he will have to pay those fines for his children unless your Excellency will remit the fines which we respecfully ask may be done.

John M Ross
R. S. Carpenter
James Carpenter
Thomas F Babbitt
L. Talandeir
Mrs. P. Estill
N W Warfield
Silas Babbit
George Babbit
William J Hitt
Jas. S. Middelton

The old man & his girls described in this petition are civil industrious negroes and from what I have learned were doubtless decoyed into this meeting. & had no idea of its unlawful character -- & will surely do so no more Hope your Excelley will remit.

Yours. S E DeHaven
If remitted send to me S E D

Oldham J. P. Ct
$15 each } Mis
Amanda & Ellen
Free negroes
Issd May 28. 1862
The unlawful assembly alluded in this petition was at my house (in my absence) & I think it a case calling for Executive Clemency --
